003
004package kut;
005
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Hashtable;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.function.BiPredicate;
010import java.util.function.Function;
011import kut.Tp;
012import kut.Lst;
013import kut.Iter;
014
015/** Hashtable&lt;String, T> */
016public class Dic<T> {
017  /** Wrapped hashtable. */
018  public final Hashtable<String, T> h;
019
020  /** Creates an empty Dic. */
021  public Dic () {
022    h = new Hashtable<>();
023  }
024
025  Dic (Hashtable<String, T> ht) {
026    h = ht;
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Constructor
031   * @param a Array.
032   */
033  public Dic (ArrayList<Tp<String, T>> a) {
034    h = new Hashtable<>();
035    for (Tp<String, T> tp : a) h.put(tp.e1, tp.e2);
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Constructor
040   * @param l Lst.
041   */
042  public Dic (Lst<Tp<String, T>> l) {
043    h = new Hashtable<>();
044    l.each((tp) -> h.put(tp.e1, tp.e2));
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Constructor
049   * @param it Iter.
050   */
051  public Dic (Iter<Tp<String, T>> it) {
052    h = new Hashtable<>();
053    it.each((tp) -> h.put(tp.e1, tp.e2));
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Creates a shallow copy.
058   * @return A shallow copy.
059   */
060  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
061  public Dic<T> copy () {
062    return new Dic<>((Hashtable<String, T>)h.clone());
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Returns 'true' if 'd' is equals to 'this' with 'f' (Same keys-values,
067   * but not same order).
068   * @param d Dic to compare.
069   * @param f Comparison function.
070   * @return 'true' if 'd' is equals to 'this' with 'f'
071   */
072  public boolean eq (Dic<T> d, BiPredicate<T, T> f) {
073    if (d.size() != size()) return false;
074    return Arr.all(
075      keys(),
076      (k) -> d.hasKey(k) && f.test(get(k), d.get(k))
077    );
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Returns the element of key 'k' or throw exception if 'k' is not found.
082   * @param k Key to search.
083   * @return Value.
084   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if 'k' is not found.
085   */
086  public T get (String k) {
087    T v = h.get(k);
088    if (v == null)
089      throw new IllegalArgumentException ("Key '" + k + "' not found");
090    return v;
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Returns the element of key 'k' or Opt.none if 'k' is not found.
095   * @param k Key to search.
096   * @return Option of value.
097   */
098  public Opt<T> getOpt (String k) {
099    T v = h.get(k);
100    return v == null ? Opt.none() : Opt.some(v);
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Returns 'true' if this has the key 'k'.
105   * @param k Key to find.
106   * @return 'true' if this has the key 'k'.
107   */
108  public boolean hasKey (String k) {
109    return h.containsKey(k);
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Returns 'true' if 'this' is empty.
114   * @return 'true' if 'this' is empty.
115   */
116  public boolean isEmpty () {
117    return h.isEmpty();
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Returns keys.
122   * @return Keys.
123   */
124  public ArrayList<String> keys () {
125    return new ArrayList<>(h.keySet());
126  }
127
128  /**
129   * Adds or replaces the value of 'k'.
130   * @param k Key.
131   * @param value Value.
132   */
133  public void put (String k, T value) {
134    h.put(k, value);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Removes 'k' or do nothing if 'k' is not found.
139   * @param k Key.
140   */
141  public void remove (String k) {
142    h.remove(k);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Replaces the value of 'k'.
147   * @param k Key.
148   * @param value Value.
149   * @throws IllegalStateException if 'k' is not found.
150   */
151  public void set (String k, T value) {
152    if (hasKey(k)) h.put(k, value);
153    else throw new IllegalStateException("Key '" + k + "' not found.");
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Returns 'this' size.
158   * @return 'this' size.
159   */
160  public int size () {
161    return h.size();
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Returns an Array with pairs 'key-value'.
166   * @return An Array with pairs 'key-value'.
167   */
168  public ArrayList<Tp<String, T>> toArr () {
169    ArrayList<Tp<String, T>> r = new ArrayList<>();
170    for (Map.Entry<String, T> e : h.entrySet())
171      r.add(new Tp<>(e.getKey(), e.getValue()));
172    return r;
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Returns an Iter with pairs 'key-value'.
177   * @return An Iter with pairs 'key-value'.
178   */
179  public Iter<Tp<String, T>> toIter () {
180    return new Iter<>(toArr());
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Returns a Lst with pairs 'key-value'.
185   * @return A Lst with pairs 'key-value'.
186   */
187  public Lst<Tp<String, T>> toLst () {
188    Lst<Tp<String, T>> r = new Lst<>();
189    for (Map.Entry<String, T> e : h.entrySet())
190      r = r.add(new Tp<>(e.getKey(), e.getValue()));
191    return r.reverse();
192  }
193
194  @Override
195  public String toString () {
196    return "{" +
197      Arr.join(Arr.map(
198        toArr(),
199        (tp) -> Str.quote(tp.e1) + ":" + tp.e2
200      ), ", ") +
201      "}"
202    ;
203  }
204
205  /**
206   * Returns values of 'this'.
207   * @return Values of 'this'.
208   */
209  public ArrayList<T> values () {
210    return new ArrayList<>(h.values());
211  }
212
213  // STATIC ------------------------------------------------
214
215  /**
216   * Returns the Dic 'JSONized' in 'js'.
217   * @param <T> Type of Dic elements.
218   * @param js Dic 'JSONized'.
219   * @param eFromJs Function to restore elements of the Dic 'JSONized' in 'js'.
220   * @return Dic 'JSONized".
221   */
222  public static <T> Dic<T> fromJs (
223    String js, Function<String, T> eFromJs
224  ) {
225    Dic<T> r = new Dic<>();
226    Js.ro(js).h.forEach((k, v) -> r.put(k, eFromJs.apply(v)));
227    return r;
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Creates a literal Dic.<p>
232   * Example:<pre>
233   *    Dic d = Dic.mk("one", "1", "two", "2")
234   * </pre>
235   * @param pairs Pairs of key value.
236   * @return A literal Dic.
237   */
238  public static Dic<String> mk (String... pairs) {
239    int sz = pairs.length;
240    if (sz % 2 != 0)
241      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Pairs 'key-value' are odd");
242    Dic<String> d = new Dic<String>();
243    for (int i = 0; i < sz; i += 2) d.put(pairs[i], pairs[i + 1]);
244    return d;
245  }
246
247  /**
248   * Returns JSON representation of 'd'.
249   * @param <T> Type of 'd' elements.
250   * @param d Dictionary.
251   * @param eToJs Function to 'JSONize' elements of 'd'.
252   * @return JSON representation of 'd'.
253   */
254  public static <T> String toJs (Dic<T> d, Function<T, String> eToJs) {
255    Dic<String> tmp = new Dic<>();
256    d.h.forEach((k, v) -> tmp.put(k, eToJs.apply(v)));
257    return Js.w(tmp);
258  }
259}
260
